io.github.utk003.util.misc

Class Verifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.utk003.util.misc.Verifier

  • public class Verifier
extends Object
    An abstract utility class for verification functions.

    This class provides these methods:

    • The fail methods, which always throw a Verifier.VerificationException.
    • The requireTrue methods, which throw a Verifier.VerificationException if and only if the given boolean expression evaluates to false.
    • The requireFalse methods, which throw a Verifier.VerificationException if and only if the given boolean expression evaluates to true.
    • The requireNull methods, which throw a Verifier.VerificationException if and only if the given object expression is not null.
    • The requireNotNull methods, which throw a Verifier.VerificationException if and only if the given object expression is null.
    • The requireMatch methods, which throw a Verifier.VerificationException if and only if the given objects or primitives do not match.
    Since:
    1.2.0
    Version:
    February 25, 2021
    Author:
    Utkarsh Priyam (utk003)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Verifier.VerificationException
      A custom runtime exception for use by the Verifier class for failed verifications.

      • requireNotNull

        @Contract(value="null -> fail")
public static void requireNotNull(@Nullable
                                                                  @Nullable Object obj)
        Throws an Verifier.VerificationException (with no message) if and only if the given object is not not-null (or, equivalently, is null).

        For a method with nearly-identical functionality that returns the argument as well, use Objects.requireNonNull(Object) instead.

        Parameters:
        obj - The Object argument to check
        Throws:
        Verifier.VerificationException - If the Object argument is null
        See Also:
        Objects.requireNonNull(Object)

      • requireNotNull

        @Contract(value="null,_ -> fail")
public static void requireNotNull(@Nullable
                                                                    @Nullable Object obj,
                                                                    String message)
        Throws an Verifier.VerificationException (with the specified message) if and only if the given object is not not-null (or, equivalently, is null).

        For a method with nearly-identical functionality that returns the argument as well, use Objects.requireNonNull(Object, String) instead.

        Parameters:
        obj - The Object argument to check
        message - The message for the exception
        Throws:
        Verifier.VerificationException - If the Object argument is null
        See Also:
        Objects.requireNonNull(Object, String)

      • requireMatch

        public static void requireMatch(Object arg1,
                                Object arg2)
        Throws an Verifier.VerificationException (with no message) if and only if the two object arguments are not equal.

        This verification method uses Objects.equals(Object, Object) to check for equality. For memory-based equality (using ==), use requireExactMatch(Object, Object) instead.

        Parameters:
        arg1 - The first argument to check
        arg2 - The second argument to check
        Throws:
        Verifier.VerificationException - If the two arguments are not equal

      • requireMatch

        public static void requireMatch(Object arg1,
                                Object arg2,
                                String message)
        Throws an Verifier.VerificationException (with the specified message) if and only if the two object arguments are not equal.

        This verification method uses Objects.equals(Object, Object) to check for equality. For memory-based equality (using ==), use requireExactMatch(Object, Object, String) instead.

        Parameters:
        arg1 - The first argument to check
        arg2 - The second argument to check
        message - The message for the exception
        Throws:
        Verifier.VerificationException - If the two arguments are not equal

      • requireExactMatch

        public static void requireExactMatch(Object arg1,
                                     Object arg2)
        Throws an Verifier.VerificationException (with no message) if and only if the two object arguments are not equal.

        This verification method uses == to check for equality. For object-based equality verification (using Objects.equals(Object, Object)), use requireMatch(Object, Object) instead.

        Parameters:
        arg1 - The first argument to check
        arg2 - The second argument to check
        Throws:
        Verifier.VerificationException - If the two arguments are not equal

      • requireExactMatch

        public static void requireExactMatch(Object arg1,
                                     Object arg2,
                                     String message)
        Throws an Verifier.VerificationException (with the specified message) if and only if the two object arguments are not equal.

        This verification method uses == to check for equality. For object-based equality verification (using Objects.equals(Object, Object)), use requireMatch(Object, Object, String) instead.

        Parameters:
        arg1 - The first argument to check
        arg2 - The second argument to check
        message - The message for the exception
        Throws:
        Verifier.VerificationException - If the two arguments are not equal
